title: How to Make an Easy Quiche Lorraine

steps.headline: Sauté the chopped onions in a little butter until translucent.
Chop the bacon, ham, onions and parsley.
steps.description: Use a food process to make this easy. # Beat the eggs very well, then toss in spices to taste: not too much salt, a good shake of white pepper and onion powder, as much parsley as you like, and a little sprinkling of nutmeg.

steps.headline: Add 2 cups of half-and-half to the mixture and mix well.
Layer the egg mixture into frozen pie crusts, dividing evenly: onion, bacon, ham, cheese, some more fresh parsley if you're using it.
Sprinkle a tiny bit more nutmeg on top if you like.
Bake at 400 °F (204 °C) for about 15 minutes, then turn the heat down to 350 °F (177 °C) and bake until golden,  30 to 45 minutes more, depending on your oven (electric ovens are often slower).
Cover the pie crust edges with foil, if they begin to brown too fast.

text: Preheat oven to 400 °F (204 °C).  Sauté the chopped onions in a little butter until translucent. This is optional. Chop the bacon, ham, onions and parsley. Use a food process to make this easy. # Beat the eggs very well, then toss in spices to taste: not too much salt, a good shake of white pepper and onion powder, as much parsley as you like, and a little sprinkling of nutmeg. Add 2 cups of half-and-half to the mixture and mix well.  Layer the egg mixture into frozen pie crusts, dividing evenly: onion, bacon, ham, cheese, some more fresh parsley if you're using it.  Pour over the egg mixture.  Sprinkle a tiny bit more nutmeg on top if you like.  Bake at 400 °F (204 °C) for about 15 minutes, then turn the heat down to 350 °F (177 °C) and bake until golden,  30 to 45 minutes more, depending on your oven (electric ovens are often slower).  Cover the pie crust edges with foil, if they begin to brown too fast.  Makes 2 pies.  Finished.
